Article Title: Why Microsoft Teams users globally must be careful when contacted by their company’s ‘IT staff’
Article Text:
How Black Basta hacking group works

Hackers are exploiting Microsoft Teams to launch sophisticated ransomware attacks against corporations globally. In a new wave of cyberattacks , criminals are impersonating corporate help desk staff to trick employees into installing malicious software , ultimately deploying the BlackBasta ransomware.According to a report by US-based cybersecurity company ReliaQuest (via Bleeping Computer), Black Basta is a ransomware operation that has been active since April 2022. The group is said to be one of the branches of the disbanded Conti cybercrime syndicate that was shut down in June 2022.Black Basta members breach corporate networks through various methods, including vulnerabilities, partnering wish malware botnets and social engineering .Previously, BlackBasta group used to flood employees' inboxes with non-malicious emails and then pose as IT help desk staff over the phone to offer assistance over ‘ongoing’ cyber attack’. The employee contacted would then be tricked into installing remote access tools like AnyDesk or enabling Windows Quick Assist, giving the attackers access to the network.Now, instead of phone calls, the attackers are utilising Microsoft Teams to contact employees. They impersonate IT help desk personnel through external user accounts with deceptive display names like “Help Desk.”"These external users set their profiles to a 'DisplayName' designed to make the targeted user think they were communicating with a help-desk account," the report says."In almost all instances we've observed, the display name included the string 'Help Desk,' often surrounded by whitespace characters, which is likely to center the name within the chat. We also observed that, typically, targeted users were added to a 'OneOnOne' chat," it added.They also create a convincing illusion of legitimacy, leading employees to believe they are interacting with internal support staff. Once the contact is established, the attackers then trick employees into installing remote access tools or enabling Quick Assist, eventually having access to the company system.
Article Summary: Hackers are exploiting Microsoft Teams to launch sophisticated ransomware attacks against corporations globally. They impersonate IT help desk personnel through external user accounts with deceptive display names like “Help Desk” Once the contact is established, the attackers then trick employees into installing remote access tools or enabling Quick Assist.

Article Title: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang: AI can help elevate India from ...
Article Text:
Time for India to change its positioning

Jensen Huang , CEO of Nvidia , believes India has the potential to become a global AI powerhouse. He emphasized the country's abundant resources, including a strong pool of tech talent, a burgeoning digital economy, and a wealth of data. By leveraging these assets, India can transition from a back-office IT hub to a front-office AI innovation center."India has all the ingredients to lead the AI revolution," Huang said. "The natural resources, the digital economy, the deep understanding of computer science—all of these elements are present here." He further stressed the importance of India retaining control over its data, asserting that the nation should harness this valuable resource to drive innovation and economic growth."To elevate yourself (India) from an IT cost reduction industry, from a labour outsourcing industry to become an AI production industry, I think you have got to pursue that with all your might. Every aspect of AI, the natural resources are here. The digital economy is here... so there are lots and lots of data. You have deep understanding of computer science, computing, you have massive resources and in order to be an AI industry, to manufacture intelligence, you need energy, data and the computer science expertise. All of three exists right here," Huang said at the recent Economic Times Conversations.Nvidia, a key player in the AI industry, has a significant presence in India. A substantial portion of the company's workforce, including senior leadership and engineers, is based in the country. India plays a crucial role in designing Nvidia's chips and developing its algorithms.Huang expressed optimism about India's future, highlighting the vibrant startup ecosystem and the strong understanding of AI's potential. He noted that AI has the power to democratize technology and empower individuals, regardless of their technical expertise. By making AI accessible to everyone, India can bridge the digital divide and unlock new opportunities for economic and social development.

Article Title: German giant Siemens may make its biggest-ever acquisition with this US engineering software giant
Article Text:

Industrial conglomerate Siemens AG is reportedly exploring a potential acquisition of Altair Engineering Inc, a leading provider of engineering software . According to a report in Bloomberg, quoting sources familiar with the matter, this move, if finalized, would mark one of Siemens' largest acquisitions to date.The report said that Siemens has been actively working with advisors to assess the feasibility of acquiring Altair, which is headquartered in Troy, Michigan. Other potential bidders could also emerge for Altair. Representatives from both companies have declined to comment on the matter.Founded by James Scapa, Altair offers a wide range of engineering software solutions to companies across various industries, including aerospace, automotive, energy, and financial services. The growing demand for such tools, driven by the increasing adoption of artificial intelligence, makes Altair a particularly attractive target for Siemens.Under the leadership of CEO Roland Busch , Siemens has been strategically shifting its focus away from heavy equipment businesses and towards higher-margin, software-driven product lines. This strategic shift aligns with the company's aim to catch up to its competitors in the automation industry, such as Rockwell Automation and Schneider Electric.The potential acquisition of Altair would further strengthen Siemens' position in the software market and enhance its capabilities in providing comprehensive engineering solutions to its customers.
Article Summary: Siemens AG is reportedly exploring a potential acquisition of Altair Engineering Inc. If finalized, this move would mark one of Siemens' largest acquisitions to date. Altair's stock has seen a significant surge of 27% this year, valuing the company at approximately $9.1 billion.

Article Title: Researchers call ChatGPT maker OpenAI’s transcription tool used in hospitals ‘problematic’
Article Text:
(AP Photo/Michael Dwyer, File)

What researchers have to say

Whisper can invent things that haven’t been said

ChatGPT maker OpenAI 's Whisper , an AI-powered transcription tool touted for its accuracy, has come under scrutiny for its tendency to fabricate information, a report has said, adding that experts have called it problematic because the tool is being used in a slew of industries worldwide to translate and transcribe interviews.According to a report by news agency AP, experts warn that these fabrications – a phenomenon known as “hallucinations” – which can include false medical information, violent rhetoric and racial commentary, pose serious risks, especially in sensitive domains like healthcare.Despite OpenAI's warnings against using Whisper in high-risk settings, the tool has been widely adopted across various industries, including healthcare, where it is being used to transcribe patient consultations.According to Alondra Nelson, who led the White House Office of Science and Technology Policy for the Biden administration until last year, such mistakes could have “really grave consequences,” particularly in hospital settings.“Nobody wants a misdiagnosis. There should be a higher bar," said Nelson, a professor at the Institute for Advanced Study in PrincetonResearchers have also found that Whisper can invent entire sentences or chunks of text, with studies showing a significant prevalence ofhallucinations in both short and long audio samples.A University of Michigan researcher conducting a study of public meetings found hallucinations in eight out of every 10 audio transcriptions he inspected. These inaccuracies raise concerns about the reliability of Whisper's transcriptions and the potential for misinterpretation or misrepresentation of information.Experts and former OpenAI employees are calling for greater transparency and accountability from the company.“This seems solvable if the company is willing to prioritise it. It's problematic if you put this out there and people are overconfident about what it can do and integrate it into all these other systems,” added said William Saunders, a San Francisco-based research engineer who quit OpenAI in February over concerns with the company's direction.OpenAI acknowledges the issue and states that it is continually working to reduce hallucinations.
Article Summary: ChatGPT maker OpenAI's Whisper has come under scrutiny for its tendency to fabricate information. Experts warn that these fabrications – a phenomenon known as ‘hallucinations’ – pose serious risks, especially in sensitive domains like healthcare.

Article Title: Broadband subscribers grew, wireless declined in August
Article Text:
Mobile Number Portability growth remains strong

India's telecommunications landscape witnessed mixed trends in August, with broadband subscriptions continuing to rise while wireless subscriptions declined, according to the latest government data.According to data provided by the Ministry of Communications, broadband subscribers increased by 0.32% in August, reaching 949.21 million, driven by growing demand for high-speed internet access. Meanwhile, total wireless subscribers decreased by 0.49% to 1,163.83 million, with declines observed in both urban and rural areas.Monthly decline rate of urban and rural wireless subscription was 0.35% and 0.66%, respectively. Private access service providers continued to dominate the market, holding a 92% share.The data also suggested that Mobile number portability (MNP) requests remained strong, with 14.66 million subscribers switching providers in August. The cumulative MNP requests increased from 1,011.13 million at the end of July to 1,025.78 million at the end of August, since the implementation of MNP.Meanwhile, machine-to-machine (M2M) cellular connections increased from 53.67 million at the end of July to 54.07 million at the end of August, with Bharti Airtel leading the market with a 52.54% share and the highest number of M2M cellular mobile connections at 28.41 million.Total telephone subscribers decreased slightly, while wireline subscribers showed a modest increase. BSNL, MTNL, and APSFL collectively held a 24.57% share of the wireline market.The number of total telephone subscribers in India decreased from 1,205.17 million to 1,200.07 million, showing a monthly decline rate of 0.42 per cent.Meanwhile, wireline subscribers increased from 35.56 million to 36.23 million with a monthly rate of growth 1.90%. The share of urban and rural subscribers in total wireline subscribers were 92.09% and 7.91%, respectively.
Article Summary: India's telecommunications landscape witnessed mixed trends in August, with broadband subscriptions continuing to rise while wireless subscriptions declined. Private access service providers continued to dominate the market, holding a 92% share. Mobile number portability (MNP) requests remained strong, with 14.66 million subscribers switching providers.

Article Title: Alibaba to pay $433.5 million to settle lawsuit over monopoly claims
Article Text:
Alibaba willpay $433.5 million to settle a US class-action lawsuit alleging monopolistic practices. Filed in 2020, the lawsuit claims Alibaba restricted merchants to a single platform, violating competition laws.

In re Alibaba Group Holding Ltd Securities Litigation

China's e-commerce giant Alibaba has agreed to pay $433.5 million to settle a US class-action lawsuit, reports Reuters. Filed by investors in 2020, the lawsuit alleges that the company engaged in monopolistic practices. It alleges that Alibaba had restricted merchants to a single distribution platform, a practice claimed to breach anti-monopoly and unfair competition laws.The company said that it has reached the settlement to avoid the expense and disruption of prolonged litigation. The settlement proposal, the e-commerce giant said, has been submitted in Manhattan federal court. It is pending approval from the US District Judge George Daniels.As per the report, the settlement covers investors in Alibaba's American depositary shares from November 13, 2019, to December 23, 2020. The settlement addresses claims that investors incurred losses when the market recognized Alibaba’s alleged misleading statements, leading to a decline in its stock price.In court filings, the plaintiffs’ lawyers described the proposed settlement as “an exceptional result,” noting that it significantly surpasses the median recovery in securities class actions where investor losses exceeded $10 billion. If the investors has proceeded with the case, Alibaba investors could have potentially pursued up to $11.63 billion in damages, according to the lawyers. The case is titled, U.S. District Court, Southern District of New York, No. 20-09568.
Article Summary: Alibaba will pay $433.5 million to settle a US class-action lawsuit alleging monopolistic practices. Filed in 2020, the lawsuit claims Alibaba restricted merchants to a single platform, violating competition laws. The company said that it has reached the settlement to avoid the expense and disruption of prolonged litigation.

Article Title: What Amazon Web Services CEO Matt Garman said when asked how many employees may leave after the company’s Return to Office mandate
Article Text:
9 Out of 10 Amazon employees, "excited" to come back to the office, says AWS CEO

AWS CEO tells the advantages of working out of the office

Amazon Web Services CEO Matt Garman said he does not know how many employees might leave the company when its mandatory five-day return-to-office policy takes effect in January, though he believes most staff support the change.Speaking at The Wall Street Journal's Tech Live event on Monday evening, Garman addressed concerns about potential employee departures , telling staff, "If it's not for you, then that's okay — you can go and find another company if you want to."The AWS chief has consistently maintained that approximately nine out of ten Amazon employees he's spoken with are "actually quite excited by this change," according to both his recent public comments and an internal all-hands meeting transcript from last week.Garman defended the stricter in-office policy by emphasising its benefits for innovation and execution speed. "Particularly as we really think about how do we want to disrupt and we want to invent on behalf of our customers, we find that there is no substitution for doing that in person," he said at the WSJ event.He highlighted the advantages of spontaneous workplace interactions, such as "writing on a whiteboard or you're talking to people in the cubicle next to you or you're running into people that are in a different department, but you see them at the coffee line." These exchanges, Garman noted, don't occur in remote work settings.The company's previous attempt at a three-day office requirement proved unsuccessful because "everybody picked a different set of three days" to come in, according to Garman.When Business Insider reached out regarding Garman's comments last week, an Amazon spokesperson declined to comment but referenced CEO Andy Jassy 's September RTO announcement. The new policy positions Amazon as taking a stricter stance on office attendance compared to other major tech companies like Google, Meta, and Microsoft, which maintain two to three-day in-office policies.Internal messages reviewed by Business Insider showed some employee dissatisfaction with the change, with one worker questioning Amazon's commitment to being "Earth's Best Employer."
Article Summary: AWS CEO Matt Garman said he does not know how many employees might leave the company when its mandatory five-day return-to-office policy takes effect in January. Garman told staff, "If it's not for you, then that's okay — you can go and find another company if you want to"

Article Title: Tesla CEO Elon Musk became $26 billion richer in just one day this week
Article Text:
Tesla CEO Elon Musk at a rally

Tesla's one of the best quarter after a bug slump

Elon Musk's empire

Tesla CEO Elon Musk 's wealth skyrocketed by a staggering $26 billion on Thursday (October 25), propelled by a significant surge in Tesla's stock price. Tesla shares soared 22% as the company had its second-best day ever on the stock market, since 2013, following an earnings beat and an uplifting projection for 2025 growth.This latest windfall solidifies Musk's position as the world's richest person, with a net worth now estimated at around $269 billion. According to Forbes, this puts him more than $50 billion ahead of good friend and former Tesla board member Larry Ellison , who remains the largest shareholder in Oracle . Musk controls close to 13% of Tesla’s outstanding shares, accounting for the bulk of his net worth.The dramatic increase in Musk's wealth was triggered by Tesla's impressive quarterly earnings report, which surpassed analyst expectations. The company's strong performance, coupled with Musk's optimistic outlook for future growth, ignited a buying frenzy among investors. Tesla's stock soared 22% on the news, marking its second-largest one-day gain since its IPO.Prior to the earnings announcement, Tesla shares had been slumping and were headed for their worst month since January. But the stock erased its loss for the year and is now up 5% in 2024, compared to the Nasdaq’s 23% gain.Beyond Tesla, Musk's wealth is further bolstered by his substantial stakes in SpaceX , X (formerly Twitter), and xAI. His ambitious ventures into space exploration, social media, and artificial intelligence have significantly contributed to his overall net worth.While Musk's business endeavors have garnered significant attention, his recent political activism has also made headlines. His public support for Donald Trump and his involvement in political campaigns have raised concerns among some investors and analysts.The US Department of Justice has even issued a warning regarding Musk's voter sweepstakes, suggesting potential violations of federal election law. This legal scrutiny could have implications for Musk and his companies.

Article Text:

According to an online report, a 23-year-old man from Kamareddy district, Telangana , has tragically lost his life after accidentally coming into contact with a live wire while his phone was charging.As reported by India Today, the victim, identified as Maloth Anil , extended a live wire near his bed to charge his mobile phone before going to sleep. During the night, Anil unknowingly touched the exposed wire, receiving a severe electric shock.Family members rushed Anil to a nearby private hospital after discovering him unconscious. Due to the severity of his injuries, he was later transferred to a government facility for further treatment. Unfortunately, despite efforts from medical professionals, Anil succumbed to his injuries.Police officials have launched an investigation into the incident. This tragedy highlights the importance of using certified chargers and electrical equipment, as well as avoiding makeshift charging setups.To ensure safe charging practices and prevent accidents, consider the following tips:* Always use the original charger that came with your phone or a certified third-party charger.* Avoid using counterfeit or low-quality chargers, as they can pose serious safety risks.* Modern smartphones have built-in battery protection features that prevent overcharging.* Once your phone is fully charged, disconnect it from the power source.* Prolonged charging can degrade the battery's lifespan.* While it's convenient to charge your phone overnight, it's best to avoid sleeping with your phone plugged in.* Overheating and potential fire hazards can occur, especially if your phone is placed under a pillow or blanket.* Regularly check your charging cables for any signs of damage, such as frayed wires or exposed metal.* Replace damaged cables immediately to prevent electrical shorts and potential fires.

Article Title: JioHotstar domain 'goes' to Dubai; new owners “welcome” everyone to their journey of Seva
Article Text:

Welcome to Our Journey of Seva

Hello! We are Jainam and Jivika – siblings from Dubai, UAE, on a mission to make a difference. Even though we’re just kids, we believe that age is only a number when it comes to spreading kindness and positivity. Our recent journey began during our summer holidays when we left our home in Dubai for 50 unforgettable days in India. We had a purpose: to connect with children from various backgrounds, share our love for learning, teach skills for studying and setting goals, and inspire them to dream big.

Throughout our journey, we were met with inspiring moments and new friendships. We taught kids not only about studying but also about having the courage to set ambitious goals. Together, we laughed, learned, and grew, creating memories that we’ll treasure forever. This website is our way of sharing those memories with you – through photos, videos, and stories from our Seva journey. We hope it brings you closer to the incredible kids we met and encourages you to spread kindness in your own special way.

Along the way, people showed their appreciation through gifts, blessings, and even small donations, which we collected over our travels. When we returned to Dubai, we used a portion of this collection to support a young software developer from Delhi by purchasing this domain for his benefit. Through sharing our journey here, we aim to inspire others and keep the domain open for future sale to anyone who wants to continue this positive mission.

And one more thing – we love taking on new challenges! Make sure to watch our videos where we’ve shared some of these fun challenges, and we hope they inspire you to try something new too.

Thank you for being a part of our journey!

Best Regards,

Jainam & Jivika

Dear Executive of Reliance Industries,

I am an app developer based in Delhi, currently working on my startup. In early 2023, while scrolling through social media, I came across a news piece stating that Disney+ Hotstar was losing daily active users after losing the IPL streaming license, and Disney is considering selling or merging Hotstar with an Indian competitor.

This led me to hypothesize that, since Sony and Zee were pursuing their own merger, Viacom 18 (owned by Reliance) is the only major player with sufficient resources to acquire Disney+ Hotstar. This reminded me of when Jio acquired the music streaming service Saavn, they rebranded it to JioSaavn, and changed the domain from Saavn.com to JioSaavn.com.

I thought, "If they acquire Hotstar, they might rename it to JioHotstar.com." I checked for the domain, and it was available. I was excited, as I felt that if this happened, I could fund my goal of studying at Cambridge.

In 2021, I was working on a project that was selected for the Cambridge University Accelerate program. It was a transformational experience for me. I couldn't crack IIT and always wanted to learn from the best, coming from a Tier-ll college, being selected for this program was an incredibly valuable and practical experience. The startup program taught me many valuable lessons and provided insights into the ins and outs of startups for free, which was amazing. However, it was limited in scope - after all it was just a startup program.

Cambridge also offers a full degree program in entrepreneurship, which l've always dreamed of pursuing but could never afford, It's Cambridge, quite expensive. When I saw this domain become available, I felt things might just fall into place.

My intention of buying this domain was simple: if this merger happens, I might be able to fulfill my dream of studying at Cambridge

Now that the merger has actually happened, and news sources are confirming there will be only one site post-merger (either JioCinema or Hotstar.com), I believe JioHotstar.com would be a very fitting brand name for the merged entity. It maintains the brand equity of both brands and provides a rational transition for the current users of both sites.

To acquire this domain, kindly reach out to mail@jiohotstar.com from your company email address with an official letter attached, stating your authorization to purchase on behalf of Reliance Industries/Viacom18. For a multi-billion dollar company like Reliance, this will be a minor expense, but for me, the sale of this domain would be truly life-changing.

Best Regards,

A dreamer.

Reliance-Disney media company may come in November

The website now reads “Hello! We are Jainam and Jivika – siblings from Dubai, UAE, on a mission to make a difference. Even though we’re just kids, we believe that age is only a number when it comes to spreading kindness and positivity. Our recent journey began during our summer holidays when we left our home in Dubai for 50 unforgettable days in India.”This comes after a Delhi-based app developer claimed to have purchased the domain earlier this week. The developer posted a letter on https://jiohotstar.com – asking the company to fund his higher studies in exchange for him giving up the domain. "My intention of buying this domain was simple: if this merger happens, I might be able to fulfill my dream of studying at Cambridge," said the app developer.Times of India Tech checked the URL which now shows a letter from the Dubai siblings along with YouTube videos depicting their work.The merger between Reliance Industries Limited 's (RIL) Viacom18 and Walt Disney 's Star India is reportedly set to be officially concluded in early November after securing regulatory approvals in India. It is expected to create India's biggest and the most powerful media and entertainment conglomerate valued at $8.5 billion. As part of the merger deal, Viacom18 will transfer its assets to Star India, which will be the operating company post the merger.This media merger will unite entertainment and sports content from popular TV channels like Colors, Star Plus, and Star Sports with streaming platforms JioCinema and Hotstar. This combined entity is expected to reach a massive audience of over 750 million viewers across India.
Article Summary: Siblings Jainam and Jivika are on a mission to spread kindness and positivity. They bought the domain JioHotstar.com for a young software developer from Delhi. They hope to keep the domain open for future sale to anyone who wants to continue their mission.

Article Title: Apple awarded $250 in patent fight with Masimo, company says “we’re not here for…”
Article Text:
What Apple’s attorney said

What the jury found

Apple has a ‘small’ win in its legal battle with medical device maker Masimo. A federal jury has ruled in favour of the iPhone maker in a patent infringement lawsuit against Masimo, awarding the tech giant a symbolic $250 in damages.According to a report by Bloomberg, the jury found that Masimo's original smartwatch designs and charger infringed on Apple Watch design patents, marking the latest development in a long-running legal battle between the two companies over smartwatch technology.The Apple attorney said that the company is not here for money but wants Masimo to stop copying its design.“We’re not here for the money. We want them to stop copying our design” and features,” Apple attorney said, lambasting Masimo for focusing on its innovations in pulse oximetry, the blood-oxygen measurement feature.An Apple spokesperson said that “teams at Apple worked for years to develop Apple Watch,” while “Masimo took shortcuts, launching a device that copies Apple Watch and infringes our intellectual property.”Masimo, on the other hand, celebrated the verdict as a victory, stating that the jury's focus on discontinued products undermines Apple's claims of irreparable harm.“Apple primarily sought an injunction against Masimo’s current products, and the jury’s verdict is a victory for Masimo on that issue,” Masimo’s statement said.The jury found that Masimo’s W1 smartwatch, Freedom smartwatch, and health module infringed on one patent, while Masimo’s charger infringed on another, as per the verdict form. The jury also found that Masimo’s infringement was willful.
Article Summary: A federal jury has ruled in favour of the iPhone maker in a patent infringement lawsuit against Masimo, awarding the tech giant a symbolic $250 in damages. The jury found that Masimo's original smartwatch designs and charger infringed on Apple Watch design patents. Apple attorney said that the company is not here for money but wants Masimo to stop copying its design.
